moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: svieshnikov variation, my favorite sicilian defense

moves.10. Bc4: white plan is to put their forces on d6
moves.10... Bb7 11. Qd3 Qc7 12. Rad1 Rfd8: is Rad8 better ? give me your opinion

i don't like this move
i prefer Bb3 
tell me about it
moves.16. Rfe1 Rdf8: protects f7 - Nf6 wants to fly
moves.17. Rd2:
i don't like this move too

moves.18. Nxe4 d5 19. Bd3:
i was waiting for Bxf7. 
white are waiting for black to take e4 and then Qxe4 to mate in h7 !
moves.32. Qd4: for a long time i analyzed Qe7, Qxa7, Qxh5 , Qxb7, e3 and black have a strong attack
moves.32... a6: first preserve a7, i don't want the pawns a and b to promote !
moves.33. Rdd1: too late ! white rooks are correctly coordinated.
moves.33... Qe7: Ok i attack both h4 and b4, and preparing e3 again
moves.34. Qb6: well !! how can i get this h4 pawn ????
moves.34... Rf8: with the idea Rf7 protects my bishop
moves.36... axb5 37. axb5:
i was expecting a5. 
now the black can take h4
moves.38... Rg5:
there is no more defence.
Kh2 ?? Rxg2  Kxg2 f3  and black mates, same for Kh1. 
Kf1 or Qe6 are a little stronger
moves.39. Kf1 e3: f3 seemed stronger, but the black have a very big attack
moves.40... f3:
gxf ?? Qxh3 mates
Rxe3 ? and the g pawn is promoted
moves.41. Qxe3: white looses a rook and the game.
